question_1.question: What is the primary reason for the change in requirements for using Oracle databases as a data source in TX?

options.option_a: Microsoft .Net framework has introduced direct Oracle Support.
options.option_b: Oracle databases no longer support TX.
options.option_c: Direct Oracle Support in the Microsoft .Net framework has been discontinued.
options.option_d: ODP.Net package has been updated to .Net 4 support.

question_1.explanation: The change in requirements is due to the discontinuation of direct Oracle Support in the Microsoft .Net framework, necessitating the installation of the ODP.Net package with .Net 4 support.

question_2.question: Which of the following steps is crucial when installing ODP.Net for TX on a machine?

options.option_a: Running the Command Prompt without administrator privileges.
options.option_b: Running the Command Prompt as administrator.
options.option_c: Installing the ODP.Net package without the Oracle Client.
options.option_d: Copying the TNSNames.ora and SQLNet.ora files to the root directory.

question_2.explanation: It is very important to run the Command Prompt as administrator when installing ODP.Net, as indicated in the provided steps for setting up the environment.
